text: I'm a 38 year old man who has had Tourette's from the age of 8. The only medicine I have found to control my tics almost 100% is Orap. When I take the medication my tics are almost none. I am very lucky not to have the speech tics. Mine are mostly ticks in my eyes and face.

I had previously been on Orsythia until my pharmacy started to fill it with Larissia which made my breasts severely sore and sensitive. From Larissia I moved on to Lutera which caused me to gain 7 lbs in 1.5 months. I did not notice an increase in appetite just an increase in weight gain. My scalp turned extremely dry and flaky to the point that I purchased several medicated and moisturizing shampoos to try and correct the issue. I experienced extreme bloating almost daily. The first day of my period was extremely painful it felt like terrible stomach inflammation.

I got Liletta in Sept 2019 and had it removed 9/28/22. Over those 3 years I gained 30lbs had no energy outrageous mood swings unpredictable periods and had a non-existent sex drive. It’s been 3 days since having it removed and the biggest thing I’ve noticed is that I’m not so drained all the time. I mean I used to run to the grocery store and would have to leave before I was done because I’d need a nap. Now I’m going through the day every day and I don’t feel like I’m constantly tired or exhausted. Also I’ve already lost 3.5lbs. I’m not eating differently or working out more. The only thing that’s different is getting the IUD removed. Time will tell with the other symptoms but I’m amazed at the progress I’ve had in just 3 short days.

It is ok for me I can't say it helps that I can notice I actually do not notice but my doctor says I have improved a lot. I don't get any side effects anymore on 200mg per night it was ok for staying asleep too as I suffer massively broken sleep it was no good for getting me to fall asleep. I rate it 5 since I personally see no improvement but my doctor does.
Just started this experiment this morning. I was prescribed this by my mental health provider of all things. She prescribed it in the form of the two pills instead of the one

I've had BV for over a year. I didn't know what was wrong with me at first so eventually I decided to go in and got told it was bacterial infection. She prescribed me the gel to take for 5 days at bedtime. All it did was give me a yeast infection it didn't clear up the BV at all. I went back and now I'm prescribed the tablets which I'm uncomfortable with due to I just took my first pill and it already have my anxiety sky high and my anxiety has been fine here lately until the pill. chest pains some cramping already. Everyone is different but I'm going to try the cream again..

I began Bupropion about a year ago. Took a while to kick in
'8 / 10Bupropion User Reviews & Ratings (Page 2)Wellbutrin XL (bupropion) for Depression1746-Feb-21MJanoI was diagnosed with Bipolar II and C-PTSD in 2015. I tried a handful of different medications but I was also dependent on alcohol. I stopped drinking August 2020 and soon after went med-free (supervised) to see where I was at. What appeared to come about was depression mostly. When I started 150mg buproprion HCL XL within 48 hrs I felt more energy more activated emotions less fog. It caused me to be more agitated and angry at first but I knew it was because I was coming from complete numbness to actually having some feelings. I am now a month in and I feel happy about where I am with my mood. I say definitely give it a chance especially if you are not a fan of SSRIs. Give it a few weeks and log your feelings. Being on this is far better than where I was in my depression. I wanted to share my experience and feelings because it has given me some hope and I want to share that with others.

I am not new to this drug I have been taking it since about 2017 when I first got diagnosed with IBS. I had suffered for a whole year before my GI prescribed this. I didn't wanna try it but after a bad episode I finally decided to take it. At first I was drowsy and had a dry mouth the first few nights but after that I was fine and the results were so worth it. I could finally EAT!!! I could enjoy the things I had given up for so long because of this horrible disease. Before this I could barely eat anything without having diarrhea and feeling sick ALL DAY.! Well I got pregt in 2022 and my doctor told me I had to get off and I was devastated but during my pregcy I didn't have too many IBS symptoms. After I had the baby all my symptoms came back!! I had lost so much weight after the baby because I was also sick. My doctor wanted me to try zofran but I told her I wanted to try getting back on my amitryptiline first and this helped so fast I can now enjoy my baby! please try it!!

I'd been on Victoza 1 or 2yrs back but w/no results. This time around I'm on Victoza & Invokana and I've lost about 8lbs since starting them 5 days ago. Except for a slight desire to eat in the AM I've lost almost all appetite. I'm nauseous almost all the time tho' and had to actually vomit on the 3rd day. But because I used Victoza in the prescribed way the 1st time around my doc suggested to start at 1.8 which may be why I'm so nauseous. I've to drink lots of water because of the Invokana but after drinking I feel like vomiting... I just realized that the nausea from drinking water has subsided since the 1st few days so I guess the general nausea is lessening too? Hard to tell especially w/no appetite.
Prior to Erelzi had been using methotrexate and prednisone. Started fall of 2020.

Strictly on this for heavy bleeding and unbearable cramps. Blisovi stopped my spotting between periods significantly reduced my cramping (I still occasionally have to use my prescription Menfenamic Acid at the onset of the first slight cramp) and reduced the heaviness of my flow. I wish it completely stopped my pains but there are still hints of the pains when I’m on the one week of iron pills. The bad side of this is it causes acne. Not horrific like my prior birth control (Trisnessa) but constant and my face has yet to be completely clear since taking this. It’s the big pimples that get really sore and red but never form a head and then when they die down they leave huge dark marks all over your face that are impossible to get rid of. IMPOSSIBLE. I just spent $230 on a facial and topical acne treatment so I hope this helps. I’m staying on it for a couple more months and if the acne (jawline neck and cheeks) persists I’ll be switching yet again.

Just started and have had breakthrough bleeding since. I’m really hoping this ends soon because my last birth control had me very sick and I’m scared I’ll have an issue with this bc also. I know it’s a trial and error thing until you find a bc that works but this is very annoying and kinda scary too
After life long anxiety all bloomed out of control and 2 years ago I finally cracked with panic disorder blooming .

I have been taking Lisinopril 20g tab for about a year now. I have real bad cough for about a month and wheezing I had to take two weeks of steroids to heal. My throat is hoarse. I seem to have swelling in my throat I get real sleepy yawning a lot and I have not been alert with my mind. I am going to talk to my doctor. I even told my son about this drug for his blood pressure. I will probably change medication or take a lower dose and see how I do.

This pill is my first one and it's okay BUT My acne is not gone already (after 3 months). I have cystic acne in the chin around the mouth. Maybe I have to wait more... Also it gave me vaginal dryness -_- (the lube don't help) so I have to buy products (like Vagisil Prohydrate Replens) to help this condition.

I was diagnosed with hypo thyroid and my Dr at the time put me on Synthroid and also tried the generic brand but my lower legs started swelling right away and continue to get worse even after three months of trying the medication. So I went outside of the general endocrine system doctor world and went to a integrative specialists and they put me on the naturethroid.

I have been on this pill Tarina Fe 1/20 for 3 years on one year off and another year on. I was so relieved that it didn’t cause weight gain or hair loss for me that I was willing to put up with other terrible side effects. For me personally anxiety and fear feelings are through the roof after about 6 months of use. It’s like feeling constant nonstop terror. It goes away as soon as I stop taking the pill. Going to the doctor to explore other options. I can’t live like this forever.

I started with symptoms in October of 2018. Went to my family doctor and didn’t diagnose me with Rosacea. She gave me a topical antibiotic and an oral prescription for itching. She told me it was inflammation of capillaries. I noticed the antibiotic was not helping. Never thought it could be Rosacea. I was finally diagnosed with this
'5 / 10Soolantra User Reviews & Ratings (Page 6)For Rosacea1116-Feb-19FrankieTaken for 6 months to 1 yearHello

Have been on this pill for over 3 years. Works well to prevent pregcy and my periods are light with little to no cramping. Only down fall is the horrible mood swings. I get super mad at little things and cry over everything. Considering switching to a new birth control because of how bad my mood swings are. I also get horrible headaches 2-3 times a week. Didn’t realize that was a side affect till I read the pamphlet that comes with the pills.
Dosage keeps getting increased and no meds added but patient is now having tremors. Physician is lowering the dose this time and adding an afternoon dose to see if it helps.
Works fine but the rebound insomnia can be awful.
I was previously taking Lexapro for my major depression but once I started having panic attacks my doctor switched me to Zoloft.
my lower stomach was hurting for months and today I went to the doctor and they said I had a bad UTI. They gave me ceftriaxone

I was 6 weeks pregt and the process was not horrific! About 2 hours after inserting the pills vaginally I started bleeding quite heavy and began passing clots. Mine were nothing noticeably big and similar to clots I see on my period. However once the bleeding began I had the worst cramps I’ve ever experienced 8/10 pain but these only lasted for a couple hours. After that I continued to have medium cramping for the next few days and bleeding was of that similar to a period. I had the worst nausea breast tenderness bloating and fatigue from being pregt. The nausea was gone within 24 hours. 1 week after my boobs are no longer tender. I am currently 2 weeks post abortion with all symptoms gone but I am still bleeding and passing clots. The bleeding ranges from light to heavy just depends on the day. Overall it was an easy experience minus the severe cramping (for a couple hours) and bleeding this long is quite frustrating.
My eyes constantly feel tired and I've had a great experience with this product.

I had several attacks of depression on the last 25 years following stress of works with variable severity. All of these attacks respond well to anafranil in 3-5 week of therapy with some side effects like sweating tremor during first 2 weeks then I take a small dose for another sevaral weeks and tapering it without problems. During the last attack of depression I did a mistake when I start treatment with zoloft depending on an opinion of a psychatrist who said to me that this drug is very good with less side effects in comparison with old drug anafranil with unpleasant side effects as he said. I m on zoloft with up to 150 mg for the last 6 weeks without significant improvement. I decide to stop this drug & return back to my anafranil

I lost 6 pounds on the first week of taking Bontril then no more lost. I didn't have cravings at first but after 3 weeks I am hungry again. Headaches are gone still doing the diet but nothing happens. I will finish the first bottle and see if it is worth it to start a second. I had high expectations.
I have been using this medicine for almost 2 years with no side effects which I am prone to from drugs because of multiple organ issues.
My daughter used Concerta for 7 years.

I got the Nexplanon implant put in November 24th so it's almost been a month since using it. I must say I've been extremely emotional since using it (even though I was emotional before) but my emotions seem to be stronger now. I haven't gotten any cramps or any pains. I did get my first period while on nexplanon and it seemed regular was very light at first and became moderate as the days went on it made my period last longer (I hope this changes). My PMS symptoms were off the charts though and my boyfriend was not liking that but other than some emotional symptoms it seems to do its job and I haven't had any other problems other than that.

I came to know that I had alopecia past September 2015.I started applying minoxidil 5%u2105 as per doctor suggestion.. Initially I started losing hair which was thin.. After 5 months the thin hair was replaced by new hair which was thick and strong... Currently still there is small new hair started growing...I have used it for one year and 4 months... Superb results...Now new hair has been originating on my head
I'm on day 5 of Clindamycin 300mg 3x daily for a a gum infection/abscess that I have had for a while.

Came back to review because I got my period!! Ladies it is true just relax and you will get your period because the pill does work! I took the pill July 26 like 30 min after protected sex but I was paranoid about pre cum so I took it as a precaution. Anyways got the withdrawal bleeding for like 6 days a week later *don't know if it was a regular period or not* but then I got
applied ointment and noticed itching and swelling in a few hours.
I’ve been on Emgality for 5 months. The seven or so seconds that the needle is in my leg

I've been using Microgestin 1/20 now for 2 weeks I'm going into my 3rd. At first I noticed that my breast were very sore but within the past couple of days I haven't noticed it as much. I also know that I have one week left of this pack and I've already started my period as well as the cramping.

After suffering from chronic rhinosinusitis on and off for years I have been prescribed Dymista and immediately my sinuses and ears felt clearer. However day 3 onwards I have felt so fatigued horrible sinus headache with sharp pains across my head feeling congested in my ears and heavy eyes. My pharmacist did initially say that I would need to use it for 3 weeks before it really gets to work. And its only day 6. So am hoping it gets better soon.
Since starting this medication I had joint pain in my arm which after 6 months escalated to severe pain which takes my breath away.

I'm 30 years old and was on ortho tri cyclen lo since I was 16 I absolutely loved it! No side affects
'2 / 10Ethinyl estradiol / norgestimate User Reviews & Ratings (Page 86)Estarylla (ethinyl estradiol / norgestimate) for Birth Control48-Mar-19AnonymousTaken for 1 to 6 monthsI have been on Estarylia birth control since January when my doctor switched me to a less hormone pill due to some issues I was having with my previous birth control. I have been experiencing headaches fatigue weight gain and depression. Then On Feb 26 2019 I found out I was pregt - yes I got pregt on Estarylia. I do not like this pill and the way it made me feel. I am usually pretty happy and this pill has changed me in multiple ways.
I just started taking it so my body still has to adjust but I notice that I have gotten some sleep. I have an extremely

I have been on Zoloft for the past two months now and last week went up to 100 mg from 50mg. No real great dramatic feelings of elation and euphoria. I would honestly say though that it has diminished my depression quite a bit and I am not quite as troubled by my regrets which really bring me down as well as the living situation I am in now. I have been struggling with suicidal thoughts for the last six months and go back and forth between wanting to just end my existence to realizing I don't want to end my life; I just want a higher quality of life.

I am now a three time partial responder my experiance with telaprevir started real well. I had a 6 week interferon lead in and was undetectable after 10 weeks at week 12. I suddenly broke out in the most awful rash with itchy red raised blotches EVERYWHERE so that ended that and was switched to boceplivir.
I am one of these people who has bad gums (no matter how much time I spend on my dental care).

If you are on this medication and are being tested every month what are the odds that if a new Dr pulls you off other meds after a year will that change the results? I was on meds for bipolar and arthritis that my new Dr took away now I can hardly move my arms without wetting my pants from the pain. This is also the Dr that told me after 25 years of taking sleep aids I now DO NOT have insomnia I have sleep apnea. Which is awesome I lay awake all night not sleeping but I have a cool mask to fight with instead of sleeping.
I've been taking Ambien for about 8 years now due to chronic insomnia.

Taking it for Shingles pain. Seems to work well but makes me tired and a bit dizzy. Doctor also prescribed an anti-seizure medicine Gabapentin so not sure which helped more. The combination seems to work really well for the nerve pain from Shingles. I would ask my Dr. for these if I ever get shingles again. I went from pretty bad pain to it feeling like someone is tickling me and it's slightly unpleasant.
I'm a diabetic and have frequent UTI'S.

I had gotten the Nexplanon in February 2020 the first 2 months I had gotten 2 periods one was normal for my body (about 4 days long) then the next month I had light bleeding for about 23 days. My doctor had told me this would be normal due to the change in hormones. At the beginning of this month Oct 2020 my breast had become extremely sore couple days later these extreme drop to the floor cramps. I had gotten my period for exactly 8 days now three days later I'm having these extreme cramps again. Also around may I had completely lost my sex drive and I still struggle with it sex has become extremely painful since.

Went on this medication. Significantly helped my Crohn's but now I am sick all the time with strep throat whooping cough or what ever else the wind blows in. This plus Crohn's ... my weight is falling like a stone. Registered myself DNR
For me metronidazole is simply does not work
I am tapering off risperidone 1/2 mg per week I was on 2 mg to start with now I’m on 1 mg.
I've been on Contrave for 3 weeks. It's expensive even with the downloaded card. I started the 4 pills/day yesterday. Today I had my follow up appt w/my Dr. & I gained 3 lbs

Bupropion works really well for my ability to focus on tasks as someone who as struggled my whole life with focus it is a godsend. Also helps SOO much with cigarette cravings as a heavy smoker and works really well with an increase in libido. Otherwise I cannot say it really does a whole lot for my anxiety.
I took 70mg Alendronate weekly only twice.
I use this daily for gut health.
49 yo male generally healthy including normal blood pressure.
Make me feel super tired and hungover the next day terrible headache and body temp fluctuations

I went to see my Dr about restless legs at night which is quite painful. She prescribed 25mg at night before bed. It's was working well..no pain. However I fell over a couple of times which I thought was odd but didn't set any alarms off. I began to feel stiff and unable to bend over to pick things up. I was afraid I would hurt myself. Not realizing this was the drug. I figured this is what happens when you are close to 50. The worst side effect was the weight gain. I was on the drug for 3.5 months and gained 30 lbs.

I started Celexa for anxiety panic attacks and depression after my 20 yr old son was killed in a car accident. I feel it numbs the tears a bit more than I want while grieving
'7 / 10Celexa User Reviews & Ratings (Page 26)For Anxiety and Stress1718-Aug-16ThunderTaken for less than 1 monthI was originally on Buspar but for some reason the anxiety started to come back. So I went to my PCP and after talking options it was decided 10mg of Celexa would help. So this is the 17th day on Cit and things seem to be starting to even out.Had stomach issues on days 1-3 but went away. Sexual effects also popped up but after checking with the wife things still work on request but just takes a bit longer.One thing that's certainly still there is the increased anxiety. It's not as bad as it was but still there.If you decide to go with this this really can make the anxiety worse.So between the 60mg of Buspar the occasional Propranolol for the days the anxiety is super bad cuz of Celexa (which is getting better) I think this drug will work.
I took Qsymia for about 6 months.

So the dosage says take 1-3 pills for a single daily dose so I took 3 and prayed for the best because I’m going on a beach trip. I’ve literally been either on the floor in my own vomit or curled up in bed with cramps so bad I want to go to the emergency room. This is TERRIBLE. Don’t buy!
Took 1 8mg Cardura daily.
I just started this drug 8/21/17 .06 mg.

So I read a handful of reviews before making a decision. I just had my son 7 months ago and finally decided on the Skyla. The reviews scared the heck out of me. But it wasn't that bad. Yes you do feel a bit of pressure and cramping but it's bearable. I took some ibuprofen and went about my day with my crawling munchkin. Hoping I don't jinx myself. But so far so good

(22F) I had panic disorder on and off for about 6 years and finally hit a point about 7 months ago where the panic attacks and anxiety took over my whole day. I wasn’t able to relax eat sleep I would go 2 or more days without sleeping and I would throw up a lot. I got prescribed Zoloft at 25mg for 2 weeks then up it to 50mg. The first week or two was pretty horrible worse anxiety rapid heart beat insomnia diarrhea but no nausea. At about 2 weeks in I had one day where all of a sudden my whole body relaxed I was calm and I could think properly…. I felt normal again! Over the next few weeks I upped it to 75mg when I started my masters program because I was getting some anxiety/panic but nothing like it was. I have zero side effects from the meds and every time I increased the dose I had a couple symptoms but no where near like how they were in the beginning. I combined it with CBT and it’s a life changing I’m successful confident and laughing again.
It was great help. Thanks
So on June 10th

Female (23) I was diegnosed with UC in 2008 at age 15. Got horrible abdominal pain I'd roll up in a ball n just cry frequent bathroom trips blood clots and dropped down to 100 pounds. I tried several medications none of them worked except prednizone.

Celexa has definitely helped me get back to my normal self but I've only been taking it a week (started with 10mg for a few days and now I'm at 20mg) and it has completely taken away my appetite. I have thrown up every day sometimes multiple times a day but I feel great otherwise. Happiness comes a lot easier so I'll deal with the excessive vomiting for a while since I need to lose some weight anyway.
I started my first dose of 750mg last night before reading the adverse side-effects!
For Breast Cancer Metastatic: My metastatic breast cancer appeared in my Sacral bone 6 years after successful treatments for stage 2 bc. I’ve been on Ibrance 125  Aromasin and

I was prescribed Elavil after 3 years of terror with SSRI and SNRIs. I have to say that it helped me tremendously with sleeping energy and headaches. I suffer from anxiety/depression. It helped with anxiety a lot. I threw away the clonazepam after 2 weeks. However for my bad luck it didn’t give me the remission —my old self. I was disconnected for three years and a half.. I was like circled not living the daily routine. If I would feel my old self I wouldn’t mind for the dry mouth and weight gain. Anyway I tapered it off and after 4 months I crashed. I tried Fetzima Cymbalta without result. Now my doctor wants to put me back to Elavil and I’m crying all day because I know will help me with most of the symptoms except for not feeling my old self—just flat all day. I can’t imagine my life feeling disconnected from my children.. what should I do?

I am on my fourth month of Apri and me and my boyfriend have never had protected sex and I have not gotten pregt. The downfalls to Apri is that I have crazy mood swings and it's taking a big toll on our relationship. We fight constantly and I have horrible mood swings and I always have nausea.
Honestly I was always anti medication. Spent 4 years with professionals (weekly appointment). This drug has changed my life. I am not longer anxious about trivial items.

Ive been on Contrave for 1 month i have lost 12 lbs. IT really curbs my appetite but the side effects have been horrible. Horrible Nausea and vomitting constantly but it keeps me from overeating. Ill keep taking because it curbs my appetite..
I've taken it for a week and I have had less anxiety in last couple of days.

My friend and I both 18 got Mirena as birth control. She loves hers. The insertion was painful but manageable- the side effects are what's really bad. Before my period was short light and I have NEVER cramped. Since getting my IUD I have consistantly bled heavily. Daily I have crippling cramps to where I can no longer continue to drive or walk. I often wake up moaning in pain and crying. I got an ultrasound yesterday and everything looked fine. I'm not saying not to get Mirena but I strongly recommend considering other options or being okay with dealing with the side effects. This has been a terrible experience for me and a great experience for my friend so you can never really be sure how it will be for you.
I am taking this for endometriosis I had the hysterectomy with removal of uterous and cervix and tubes it's day 2  I had a headache and light cramping
I'm a 49 year female and I'm at 384lbs.

I used to swear by Abreva growing up as I got multiple outbreaks a year one after another and they would last a week or so with Abreva. Due to the cost of what I was spending on Abreva I turned to more natural remedies and in doing that I usually only get 1-2 outbreaks a year. I don’t know if the rate of how often I was/am getting them is related but seems a bit like a coincidence. Instead I now use ice when I can feel it tingle: to help with swelling and I use a baking soda/water mix followed by a skin-safe tea tree oil mix. This new process has helped my cold sores last about 3 days total: from tingling to disappearing. I do not touch Abreva anymore.
I had 3 injections in 3 weeks. That was two and a half months ago. I have gotten not one ounce of relief. Doc gave me prednisone today hoping it will give me a boost.

Thank you everyone for sharing your views. For those that Seroquel has helped
'10 / 10SeroquelFor Bipolar Disorder60EpGuy13-Feb-21Seroquel has been nothing short of a miracle for my depression anxiety sleep and mood. I take 800 mg at night around 10 pm and it has helped me in ways I couldn’t have imagined. The side effect of weight gain has been significant but I’ll gladly take the trade of being fat.

I had Mirena put in Jan 2020 (age 19) after being on Junel for 3.5 years and it is the worst decision I’ve ever made. Previously I had 4-5 days of light periods with bad cramps and PMS. Junel helped a lot but I was getting annoyed with taking pills. For the past 3 years Mirena has made my periods 11 full days with only 10 days between each period. With this I have had horrible nausea cramping and insane mood swings/depression. Along with this I have gained 20 pounds even though I work out intensely 4-5 times a week and eat relatively healthily. I kept on it because everyone said this was an “adjustment period” but I’ve had enough and am switching to a new pill in a month and getting it removed. I really don’t recommend this for anyone especially younger women as it has had a horrible effect on my mental health. I didn’t get pregt so it worked in that aspect but ruined every other part of my life.
I just realized the reason for me being so sick.
This was the 2nd birth control I have been put on.
I was on Paxil 20mg for 16 years to treat MDD.
Just began methenamine

On a bright side this medication reliably puts me to sleep. On a bad side it gives me very fragmented and interrupted sleep. I sleep for 8-9 hours. But I have constant vivid dreams wake up many times during the night (although go back to sleep quickly). I don't have any significant side effects next morning but don't feel rested at all.
I have had Kyleena since 12/17/2020.
This medication will help with my migraine headache for the day but I wake up and still have a terrible headache once the medication subsides.

I am a heart patient and been taking Pradaxa for about a month now I take 150mg twice a day. Every time I take this pill I have a severe case of acid reflux and heart burn. Nothing seems to help relieve the burning. I also have ulcers in my stomach and it always makes me feel nauseated. I had been using Coumadin since 2001 and had a lot of bruising and bleeding problems. I believe Pradaxa would be good if it wouldn't be so harsh on the stomach and esophagus.

I am 72 years old and have suffered with Chronic Urticaria for 18 months now 24/7 and my antihistamines and prednisone are no longer helping. My Dr. suggested that I try Xolair. I have had my 2nd injections today and have had no decrease in my hives. I have read that it may take 2 or 3 months before it kicks in but I was sure hoping that I would have some relief in the first month especially because of the cost of this drug. I will continue for a couple more months to give it a fair chance.

Taking the liquid form Cherritussin helped my cough very much. It was a great sleep aid when sick but should not be over used. Also I would add DO NOT TAKE THIS AND THEN DRINK COFFEE! I didn't realize that the stimulant of caffeine mixed with it would bother me. Also check to see if pseudoephedrine is mixed in any way with your codeine as this is also a stimulant and worsens the situation.
I've used this medication benztropine for two different occasions of Extrapyramidal Reaction (EPR's).
I had to stop Prozac which worked very well on me but unfortunately started causing neutropenia and related skin problems.

Works well for my major post-spine fusion surgery causing foot leg and back neuropathy pain going on my second year. People saying it is worse than the pain itself don't know what real pain is and should be using Vicks Tiger Balm or maybe baby aspirin. This stuff works with taking Turmeric capsules as an anti-inflammatory. Just learn to use it wisely and when really needed so as not to get desensitized to it.

I have been using Olmesartan for 9 months. I am a 63 year old male with no prior medical history. My lifestyle has always been healthy (intake-wise) but increasingly sedentary and stressful and I think these factors are what exacerbated my BP. Otherwise I was healthy: non-smoker low alcohol average weight etc. My wife finally convinced me to get a routine medical check-up
I've had 2 surgeries nerve stimulant injections nerve burns Physical Therapy chiro acupuncture and every medicine made.

Day two of methyl prednisone. Headaches insomnia dizziness nausea even taken with food. Pain ratio still at eight hopefully will get to zero with massage and acupuncture. I have seen wonders with this medication I just pray I am one of the wonders.

This was my second pill that I was put on and for the two years of taking it I’ve felt my mental state completely switch. I’m now so insecure and anxious all of the time and the PMS I experience is insane. I have to cry multiple times on my period and before because I get overwhelmed and feel literal pain like a buildup if I don’t. The PMS cramping is ridiculous and it hasn’t done anything for my acne except for make it worse. It helped to regulate my period but I also sometimes would start on Mondays and other times I’d start on Tuesdays. Also I would bleed like insane amounts of blood one day and the next I won’t even need a tampon.
